title: Square loop pulled through a magnetic field

content.question: The gray rectangle in the figure above represents a region of uniform magnetic field directed out of the page. A square loop of wire of side s is in the plane of the page and is pulled at constant speed v through the field. Which of the following could show the current I in the loop as a function of the position of the right edge of the loop?

choices.label: Option A shows a horizontal line beginning near the top of the vertical axis and extending to 2 s where it continues vertically down to the x axis, and is then horizontal along the x axis until reaching 3 s.
Option B shows a horizontal line beginning near the top of the vertical axis and extending to 3 s where it continues vertically down to the x axis.

Option C shows a horizontal line beginning near the top of the vertical axis and extending to s where it continues vertically down to the x axis. It is then horizontal along the x axis until reaching 2 s. The line then extends vertically down to near the bottom of the vertical axis and extends horizontally to 3 s, where it then extends vertically up to the x axis.

Option D shows a straight line beginning at the origin and extending up and to the right until reaching s where it then extends vertically down to the x axis. It is then horizontal along the x axis until reaching 2 s. The line then extends vertically down to near the bottom of the vertical axis and then becomes a straight line extending up and to the right until reaching 3 s on the horizontal axis.

content.answer: Option C shows a horizontal line beginning near the top of the vertical axis and extending to s where it continues vertically down to the x axis. It is then horizontal along the x axis until reaching 2 s. The line then extends vertically down to near the bottom of the vertical axis and extends horizontally to 3 s, where it then extends vertically up to the x axis.
